projects.title: LaWeather App
projects.description: A full-stack weather application that provides real-time weather information based on the user’s location, with interactive features and a clean, intuitive UI.

projects.title: Suomen Latu CRM
projects.description: Customer relationship management (CRM) system developed specifically for the association users of Suomen Latu

projects.title: Taitovarasto
projects.description: Taitovarasto is an innovative web application designed to streamline the talent acquisition process by allowing companies to explore a pool of anonymized candidate profiles. Developed for Virittämö Helsinki.

projects.title: Kyky-today web app
projects.description: The Kyky Web Application is a platform designed to connect freelancers with potential clients. It serves as a marketplace for a wide range of services, catering to both freelancers seeking to offer their services and clients in need of these services.

projects.title: Employee feedback app
projects.description: This web app is designed and developed as part of our school project. The customer was EXOVE. It is supposed to be used by the company's HR team to get feedback from employees.

projects.title: Dino's last word
projects.description: A simple Hangman-inspired game, except it's dinosaur vs. meteor. The game allows the user to guess a randomly generated word by entering letters one at a time.

projects.title: Habit Tracker
projects.description: Habit-Tracker is an application that helps you to keep up with your daily habits. This is our team project which is created by 4 team members.

projects.title: TasteIT app
projects.description: This is a web application where users can add their own food recipes from their own traditional kitchen as well as from around the world.

projects.title: Animals&Birds
projects.description: This is a web application where users can get pictures of animals and birds by their name, add/remove likes to/of each animal/bird.

projects.title: FormTask
projects.description: This is a web application where users can input their notes and messages and send it to the database kept in .json format in local machine.

projects.title: Sorting
projects.description: This is a web application where users can check palindrome word or sentences, play with bubble sorting and practice Stack and Queue data structures.

projects.title: Pokedex
projects.description: This is a web application where I fetch Pokemon data from internet and display them in separate cards allocated for each of Pokemons.

projects.title: Speedgame
projects.description: Click as many pizzas as you can and get points.

projects.name: 7th Internet Governance Forum
projects.description: As the project manager, I led the IT support for the Forum organized by the United Nations in Baku, Azerbaijan, from November 5-9, 2012. The forum was expected to host over 2,000 physical attendees and tens of thousands of online participants. Our main task was to provide technical equipment and computer systems to support online broadcasting, sound management, and interactive participation for sessions held simultaneously in over 12 meeting rooms in more than 10 languages, based on UN's technical requirements. We assembled a team of approximately 40 specialists and 30 volunteers to ensure the event's success. The technical support was successfully implemented, and I was awarded a certificate by the United Nations for our efforts.

projects.name: People's Computer Project
projects.description: The project, launched in July 2009, aimed at providing school teachers with modern computers, it later expanded to include students and university educators. The project's objectives were to facilitate access to affordable, licensed software-equipped computers, promote public education in the global information space, protect intellectual property, and support low-income social groups. Buyers could acquire computers without an initial payment, through interest-free credit, and at 25-30% below market rates. Over 27,000 individuals benefited from these terms. As the project coordinator, I oversaw its successful implementation and delivery.

projects.name: Registry of Information Systems Containing Personal Data
projects.description: In 2013, as the Product Owner and Project Manager appointed by the Ministry of Communication and IT, I spearheaded the development of a comprehensive registry for Information Systems containing personal data. The project was mandated to comply fully with all legal acts regarding personal data protection. My responsibilities included defining the product vision, managing the product backlog, and collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the system met all regulatory and compliance requirements. The system was successfully developed by the selected vendor and was delivered to the Ministry on time, fulfilling all contractual obligations and quality standards.
